author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
Using Get-Help Get-Service -Parameters it giving an error.  Works file when using -Full parameter.

Get-Help Get-Service -full and Get-Help Get-Service -detailed - Works

FYI - this also fail in Windows PowerShell! I will create an incident in UserVoice!

Steps to reproduce
------------------
The following command error out!
```powershell
Get-Help Get-Service -Parameter
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
To display the help for Get-Service for parameters only.
No errors!

```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6-preview> Get-Help Get-Service -Parameter
Get-Help : Missing an argument for parameter 'Parameter'. Specify a parameter of type 'System.String' and try again.
At line:1 char:22
+ Get-Help Get-Service -Parameter
+                      ~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (:) [Get-Help], ParameterBindingException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : MissingArgument,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetHelpCommand
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6-preview> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17677
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6-preview>

```
![pwsh_servparamissue_2018-05-31_11-53-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/40793188-c015b052-64c9-11e8-92f9-26726226b11c.jpg)

![winpwsh_servparamissue_2018-05-31_11-53-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/40793218-d717530a-64c9-11e8-84a2-3086bcaa6738.jpg)

![pwsh_servdetailed_2018-05-31_11-53-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/40793290-0aa38b1c-64ca-11e8-9b8f-ab7484811dc0.jpg)

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body:
@MaximoTrinidad There is no `-Parameters` parameter to `Get -Help`, only `-Parameter` which takes as an argument the name of the parameter to get help on.
```
Get-Help [[-Name] <string>] -Parameter <string> [-Path <string>] [-Category <string[]>] [-Component <string[]>] [-Functionality <string[]>] [-Role <string[]>]
```
If you specify a valid parameter name, you'll get output on that parameter:
```
PSCore (1:35) >  get-help get-service -parameter RequiredServices

-RequiredServices [<SwitchParameter>]
    Indicates that this cmdlet gets only the services that this service requires.

    This parameter gets the value of the ServicesDependedOn property of the service. By default, this cmdlet gets all services.

    Required?                    false
    Position?                    named
    Default value                False
    Accept pipeline input?       False
    Accept wildcard characters?  false
```

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
I have tripped on this myself a few times. it does take wild cards so this works:

```powershelll
get-help Get-Service -Parameter *
```

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body:
@BrucePay  @markekraus   I think this is a kind of feature request to have a parameter which can list `Help` for a cmdlet by detailing only the Parameters in it.

@MaximoTrinidad  `(Get-Help Get-Service).Parameters` can be used here.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @kvprasoon you can already do that with `Get-Help Get-Service -Parameter *`. though.. to find that out you do have to run `Get-Help Get-Help -Parameter Parameter`... 🤣

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
OK!!  I got it know.  
So, it needs a string value.  Sorry!

I thought a default "All" value was already set for it.  Dah!!

Thanks Everyone!
I will close the issue.
:)

title: PSCore6 - Get-Service -Parameters Help information is missing.
